Docs.summary: A designed for creating and validating Json Web Tokens. See: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7519 and http://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc7515.
Docs.remarks: This partial class is focused on TokenCreation.

Docs.summary:
Gets or sets the which is used when setting the for claims in the extracted when validating a .
The is set to the JSON claim 'name' after translating using this mapping.
The default value is ClaimTypeMapping.InboundClaimTypeMap.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool MapInboundClaims { get; set; }
.property instance bool MapInboundClaims
Public Property MapInboundClaims As Boolean

Docs.summary:
Gets or sets the property which is used when determining whether or not to map claim types that are extracted when validating a .
If this is set to true, the is set to the JSON claim 'name' after translating using this mapping. Otherwise, no mapping occurs.
The default value is false.

Docs.param: A 'JSON Web Token' (JWT) in JWS or JWE Compact Serialization Format.
Docs.summary: Converts a string into an instance of .
Docs.returns: A
Docs.remarks:
If the is in JWE Compact Serialization format, only the protected header will be deserialized. This method is unable to decrypt the payload. Use to obtain the payload.
The token is NOT validated and no security decisions should be made about the contents. Use or to ensure the token is acceptable.

Docs.param: The token to be validated.
A required for validation.
Docs.summary: Validates a token. On a validation failure, no exception will be thrown; instead, the exception will be set in the returned TokenValidationResult.Exception property. Callers should always check the TokenValidationResult.IsValid property to verify the validity of the result.
Docs.returns: A

remarks.para: TokenValidationResult.Exception will be set to one of the following exceptions if the is invalid.

para.exception: if the validationParameters.TokenReader delegate is not able to parse/read the token as a valid ,
